Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is a clean and highly efficient power generation device, garnering great interest in the context of carbon neutralization.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment

Sentencas: In addition to pure hydrogen, it is also applicable to various hydrocarbon fuels for power generation, including gas hydrate (GH)-a promising energy resource that is reserved globally.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment

Sentencas: Here, for the first time, we demonstrate the utilization of CH4-CO2-rich fuel gas released from lab-made GH in SOFC to achieve the purpose of gas and power cogeneration through the so-called GH-SOFC.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment

Sentencas: The experiment was performed using the classic cermet Ni-based, anode-supported cells to evaluate the electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of GH-SOFC (837 mW cm(-2) @800 degrees C), which is found to be higher than the CH4-CO2-SOFC with the stoichiometric ratio for the dry reforming reaction.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment

Sentencas: Furthermore, we achieved high methane conversion rates with GH-SOFC, surpassing CH4-SOFC and CH4-CO2-SOFC.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment

Sentencas: After the durability test, we observed nearly no carbon deposition on the anode, indicating a robust performance of the good applicability of SOFC for efficient utilization of GH.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Using Gas Hydrates for Power and Syngas Cogeneration: A Thermodynamic and Experimental Assessment
